授業目的: This course is designed for students who are concerned about international issues such as militarism, post-colonialism, environmental matters, economic disparities, and so on. The purpose of the class is to make students aware of what is going on in the world and how it relates to their own lives, and to ask them to consider how problems can be solved to bring about a better society. The class will be conducted in a seminar format with students being expected to raise discussion points and to give presentations. The goal is to enable them to understand the historical contexts of war and militarism.
到達目標: Integrating world issues while simultaneously grasping an understanding of its connections.
特記事項: 本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.

第1回:
Week 1: Method and direction of the class.
Face to face format for All 14 lectures.
第2回: Week 2: Concepts to be employed in the class.
第3回: Week 3: Historical backgrounds to World Wars I and II.
第5回: Week 5: Post-war international organizations and militarism.
第6回: Week 6: The history of nuclear development.
第14回: Week 14: Students’ final presentations and evaluation of the class.
